member.summary: Gets or sets the CommerceEntity name. This is the name of the CommerceEntity class that this property belongs to.
member.remarks: This name is the short name of the CommerceEntity that corresponds to the CommerceEntityDefinition.Name property - Product, Address etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Commerce.Contracts.CommerceEntities.Metadata.PropertyDefinition.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the multilingual value Format. This is a string that defines the CommerceEntity property formatting.
member.remarks: This string corresponds to the format parameter in the String.Format method. Format can be different for different languages. This is an optional property.
member.example: For example, "{0,10:F4}" - this format string specifies that the output of the property value will occupy 10 positions and will be formatted as a fixed point number with 4 digits after the decimal point.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Commerce.Contracts.CommerceEntities.Metadata.PropertyDefinition.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the relationship list Constraints. This is a list of the Constraint objects associated with the CommerceEntity property.
member.remarks: Each constraint defines a validation rule. The validation rules are combined using logical "AND" operator, which means that the property is valid if none of the constraints is brokean; the property is invalid if any of the constraints is brokean. This is an optional property. TODO: VK. Should we consider "AND" Constraint Container and "OR" Constraint Container similar to the EntLib Validation framework?

member.name: P:Microsoft.Commerce.Contracts.CommerceEntities.Metadata.PropertyDefinition.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the multilingual Default value. This is the CommerceEntity property's default value.
member.remarks: This is an optional property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Commerce.Contracts.Messages.CommerceCreateOperation
member.summary: Represents a Create operation. The Create operation can: 1. Create new commerce entities 2. Create new commerce entities related to the model 3. Create new relationships between a new source commerce entity and existing commerce entities. When then intent is to create a related item or relationship to an existing commerce entity, use the update operation on that existing commerce entity. As an example, if an address is to be added to an extsting UserProfile, then Update 'UserProfile' must be used.
